description: A change of use from C3(a) to assisted living accommodation to provide a supported living environment for 3 individuals with specific care needs.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
Reason:-
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
Reason:-
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.
There should be a no more than 3 adult residents receiving care by up to 3 carers on a shift pattern basis.
Reason: -
To protect neighbouring amenity.
The property shall not be occupied by more than 3 residents at any time and the maximum level of occupancy of each bedroom shall not exceed 1 person at any time.

Reason:- To maintain the level of occupancy in accordance with the proposed use for specialist accommodation and to maintain a level of occupancy similar to that of a single family dwellinghouse, in the interests of mitigating amenity impacts for neighbours and ensuring a quality of internal living spaces and amenity space for future occupants.
None of the communal rooms/spaces shall be used as bedrooms and shall remain as communal areas available for the use of all occupiers.
Reason:- To maintain a satisfactory living condition for future occupiers.
The use hereby permitted must be operated in accordance with the operational management proposals as provided in an email dated 5th December 2023 by Team Motivate.
Reason: To ensure the safety of service users, staff and visitors and to protect the amenity of neighbours.
Community Safety Informative

It is suggested that continual discussion takes place between the applicant and the Metropolitan Police Service Designing out Crime Officers (DOCOs) regarding the required recommendations and security standards for this application. The services of MPS DOCOs are available free of charge and can be contacted via docomailbox.ne@met.police.uk
Refuse Collection Informative
Waste and recycling sacks will need to be presented by 7am on the boundary of the property, facing 3 Lilliput Road on the scheduled collection day.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with Team Motivate (the applicant), via email/phone at various times. The revision involved providing details of the managing process / procedures in event of anti-social behaviour. Additional information was subsequently submitted on 05 December 2023.

phasing_details.phase_detail: Entire development to be completed in a single phase
